content.description: Concert tickets went on sale at noon (t = 0) and were sold out within 9 hours. The number of people waiting in line to purchase tickets at time t is modeled by a twice-differentiable function L for 0 ≤ t ≤ 9. Values of L(t) at various times t are shown in the table above.
content.question: The rate at which tickets were sold for 0 ≤ t ≤ 9 is modeled by r(t) = 550te-t/2 tickets per hour. Based on the model, how many tickets were sold by 3 P.M. (t = 3), to the nearest whole number?

frqParts.text: The rate at which tickets were sold for 0 ≤ t ≤ 9 is modeled by r(t) = 550te-t/2 tickets per hour. Based on the model, how many tickets were sold by 3 P.M. (t = 3), to the nearest whole number?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
